translations.Unable to communicate with Etherpad API: Unable to communicate with Etherpad API due to the following error: “%s”.
translations.Invalid name, '\\', '/', '<', '>', ':',: Invalid name: '\', '/', '<', '>', ':', '"', '|', '?' and '*' are not allowed.
translations.The target folder has been moved or dele: The target folder has been moved or deleted.
translations.The name %s is already used in the folde: The name %s is already used in the folder %s. Please choose a different name.
You are not allowed to open this pad.
translations.URL in your Etherpad/Ethercalc document: URL in your Etherpad/Ethercalc document does not match the allowed server
translations.Unable to authenticate to Etherpad API: Unable to authenticate to Etherpad API
translations.Create and open Etherpad and Ethercalc d: Create and open Etherpad and Ethercalc documents.
translations.Ownpad is a Nextcloud application that a: Ownpad is a Nextcloud application that allows to create and open Etherpad and Ethercalc documents. This application requires to have access to an instance of Etherpad and/or Ethercalc to work properly.
translations.This is used to link collaborative docum: This is used to link collaborative documents inside Nextcloud.
translations.Ownpad is not correctly configured, you: Ownpad is not correctly configured, you should update your configuration. Please refer to the documentation for more information.
translations.You need to enable Etherpad API if you w: You need to enable Etherpad API if you want to create “protected” pads, that will only be accessible through Nextcloud.
translations.You have to host your Etherpad instance: You have to host your Etherpad instance in a subdomain or sibbling domain of the one that is used by Nextcloud (due to cookie isolation).
translations.Enable OAuth2 authentication to communic: Enable OAuth2 authentication to communicate with Etherpad (introduced in Etherpad 2)
translations.In order to enable OAuth2 authentication: In order to enable OAuth2 authentication in Etherpad, you need to configure a dedicated service account. Please refer to the Etherpad documentation to proceed.
translations.The following error occurred while tryin: The following error occurred while trying to authenticate to Etherpad: {message}
translations.For example, if you host your Etherpad i: For example, if you host your Etherpad instance on `pad.example.org` and your Nextcloud instance on `cloud.example.org` you need to configure your cookie to `example.org` domain.
translations.Delete Etherpad pads when moved to trash: Delete Etherpad pads when moved to trash
translations.Your Etherpad/Ethercalc document could n: Your Etherpad/Ethercalc document could not be opened, the following error was reported: “%s”.
